expl_crossbow: A suction cup is mechanically designed to attach to smooth or flat surfaces making it best fit for machines that requires a temporary grip for objects.On the hand a star shaped bow will not hold nor support a machine.
expl_balloon: A weight is a solid object that can provide balance within a machine, whereas a kid is a living thing not a component.

expl_cutter:
The whisk is more suitable because its round shape and lightweight design make it better for connecting to or turning with the pulley system. 

A knife wouldn’t work as well since it’s flat and sharp, which makes it unsafe and not practical for this type of mechanism.
expl_wheel:
The mouse is more suitable because it can run on the wheel and create movement that powers the rest of the mechanism. 

A wheel reflector can’t move on its own, so it wouldn’t produce any motion or help the setup work properly.
expl_crossbow:
The suction cup is more suitable because it can stick firmly to smooth surfaces, like the balloon or other parts of the machine. 

This makes it useful for holding things in place or helping to transfer movement. 

The star, however, is just decorative and doesn’t have any gripping ability, so it wouldn’t work properly in the mechanism.
expl_balloon:
The weight is more suitable because it can pull the string or balloon down with a steady force, helping the mechanism work properly. 

A child wouldn’t be practical since they’re too heavy and unpredictable, while the weight provides consistent movement that keeps the setup functioning smoothly.
